ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I genuinely think I am a better writer and more creative writer after this course. It gave me a lot of freedom in my writing, which is something I have never really had in a class before. I never considered myself a good writer but I've always wanted to be so this course helped me refine my writing skills and practice writing a lot.
I really improved my writing and learned to like creative writing. I improved literally every aspect of my writing.
Creative writing skills, story telling skills.
Nonfiction writing skills in personal narratives, satire, and cultural critiques. I gained a lot of insight into my personal difficulties and problem areas when it comes to writing.
My writing and close reading skills really improved over the course of ENGL 120. I learned a lot about the various forms of nonfiction writing that exist in the current literary space.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: individual writing and feedback is heavily present, very engaging, Maggie is the BEST professor. She is honestly just so intelligent and it is so evident when she discusses different readings with us in class. 
Weaknesses: Many of the readings were not what we were modeling in our own personal essays - for example, many readings would be long but our essays were only supposed to be a maximum of 1500 words so it would have been more helpful to read essays that had a similar format / structure to what our assignments were.

I really liked the structure of the course. Writing two versions of each essay was so helpful. Also getting workshopped was a good experience. Weakness would be the amount of reading we were assigned for every class
Was a very engaging course. My writing improved. Heavy workload. Sometimes grading felt subjective.

Strengths: Our instructor created a lively and engaging discussion environment where we could all voice our ideas comfortably and actually discuss different opinions on the readings, but she also guided us extremely well through more complex texts and gave us her very insightful thoughts when needed. Her feedback on our assignments was always clear and detailed, and I felt like she genuinely cared about us and our writing! Weaknesses: Can't think of any.
We got a lot of feedback from the professor on our own work which is good. When we read the published essays I wanted more guidance on what in particular I was supposed to focus on in my annotations.
I really enjoyed this course. I thought it was well organized, and I found all of the reading and writing assignments to be very engaging. The individualized feedback was also very helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES- it is a very fun course and yes, it is a decent amount of work but I truly think it is a very engaging class to take and is different from many other writing classes.
Yes! It improved my writing so much.
Yes if you enjoy reading and writing. It is a high workload so you have to be engaged in the material.
Yes!!!! This course was fantastic. Take it with Maggie if you can.
I would definitely recommend this course to everyone. It is a great class to read a lot of different essays and improve your writing. Theres a fair amount of work but nothing difficult or excessive.

I would recommend this course to any student interested in writing nonfiction. It improved my understanding of the modern essay and my close reading skills in general, and class discussions were engaging and entertaining.
